description:
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.

The Supplier and Procurement Support Operations team strives to have the best internal purchasing tools, systems and processes available. As a member of this team, you will find innovative ways to improve the buying process for Googlers.

As the Systems Project Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring complex systems initiatives across Supplier, Procurement and Support Operations are well implemented. You will work closely with the operations teams to synthesize and interpret their requirements into a well designed solution. You can speak the language of the Developers and collaboratively define the system roadmap and implementation plan. You will prioritize functionality and execute testing to deliver a product that exceeds your stakeholders’ expectations. Additionally, you will work with a team and get things done in an ambiguous environment.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 6 years of experience in procurement systems.
  • Experience in UX design, Agile scrum development and/or Waterfall development.
  • Experience in change management, new system builds and/or project management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to lead, plan, execute and deliver on projects in a timely manner.
  • Excellent leadership, cross-functional communication and interpersonal skills.
responsibilities:
• Partner with key stakeholders to analyze requirements and develop a cohesive cross-functional, multi-year systems vision.
  • Lead project management and implementation of large scale systems projects.
  • Evaluate how system changes impact P2P processes, provide recommendations for operational improvements and help stakeholders manage change.
  • Work side by side with Engineering and UX teams to evaluate requirements, design solutions, execute testing and deliver core functionality to stakeholders. Identify recurring issues and resolve them with Engineering to ensure no impact to supplier and procurement operations and serve as a key resource for best practices in software development methodologies and UX design.
  • Communicate product roadmap and manage expectations with Finance leadership.
title: FinOps Systems Project Manager
